text: In Greek mythology, Hippodamas ( ; Ancient Greek: Ἱπποδάμας, gen. ) may refer to the following characters: * Hippodamas, son of Achelous and Perimede, daughter of Aeolus; brother of Orestes and father of Euryte, wife of Porthaon.Hesiod, Catalogue of Women fr. 10(a)Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca, 1.7.3 & 1.7.10 *Hippodamas, father of Perimele. He pushed his daughter off a cliff when he discovered that she was having a love affair with Achelous.Ovid, Metamorphoses, 8. 591 ff * Hippodamas, a Trojan prince and son of King Priam of Troy.Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca, 3.12.5 He was killed by Ajax the Great.Dictys Cretensis, 3. 7Hyginus, Fabulae, 113, where he is called "Hippodamus" * Hippodamas, another Trojan, was killed by Achilles.Homer, Iliad, 20. 401-406 == Notes == == References == * Dictys Cretensis, from The Trojan War.
